page.title: 02The transport in the area
page.content: Although transport is somewhat limited it has in general improved in recent years.There is a daily bus service which consists of a once a day service to Newark,Nottingham,or Bingham (the main shopping towns in the area).There is access to several railway stations close by.There is a small frieght line which connects Newark and Grantham on a single line track.This used to be used only for transporting locally mined gypsum but as this is now transported mainly by road the line only transports fuel.Most residents have use of at least 1 car per home as this is the best way for residents to travel for commuting to and from work, for shopping or for social activities. There is some use for cycle transport but mainly for pleasure.
